article.title: What requirements or conditions must be met before adopting a pet?
article.body: 1.Must be a Filipino citizen 2.Must be a resident of San Jose del Monte, Bulacan 3.Must be 18 years old and above 4.2x2 ID Picture 5.Valid ID 6.Leash or Cage (Kulungan o Tali)

article.title: Are the pets in good health?
article.body: Yes, the pets that are available for adoption are in good health and have undergone tests by the City Veterinary Office.

article.title: Is there a cost involved?
article.body: There are no costs involved, but be sure you have the necessary requirements.

article.title: What is the maximum number of pets that can be adopted?
article.body: For dogs, at most two can be adopted, and any number of cats as long as you have the capacity and financial means to adopt. The owner must be able to provide food and shelter for the adopted pet. They will also be responsible for the healthcare and hospitalization of their pet/s.

article.title: Can I return a pet after adoption?
article.body: Returning or surrendering a pet is prohibited by law, but if the owner can provide a legally valid reason, please reach out to the City Veterinary Office.

article.title: How do I find out if my request to adopt a pet has been granted?
article.body: Silong will email you to let you know if your adoption request has been approved after it has been submitted.

article.title: Can I still adopt a pet even though it is outside the authorized neighborhoods or areas?
article.body: Users who are not covered or who live outside of the City of San Jose del Monte, Bulacan will not be permitted to adopt by City Veterinary.

article.title: “I have more questions…”
article.body: Please send a message to the City Veterinary Office’s Facebook Page, or go to Menu and tap “About the Office” to learn more.

article.title: Basic Troubleshooting Guide
article.body: 1.Check your internet connection 2.Swipe down to refresh 3.Check your phone's date and time 4.Clear App’s data and cache in the phone’s settings 5.Uninstall the App 6.Restart your phone 7.Logout and log back in

article.title: Forgot or Reset password
article.body:
1.Go to the login screen 2.Tap “Forgot Password?” 3.Provide registered email address 4.Tap “Submit”
If you are logged in and trying to change your password, go to "Edit Profile" then tap "Account Security" and select "Reset Password", after you provide a registered email address, tap "Submit".

article.title: Problem logging in
article.body: Please refer to the Basic Troubleshooting Guide and, preferably, perform the steps one at a time. If problem persists, reach out to the City Veterinary Office.

article.title: No photos of pets are shown
article.body: Tap filter, mark all of the available options. If problem persists, refer to the Basic Troubleshooting Guide and, preferably, perform the steps one at a time.

article.title: Changing Account Details
article.body: Go to the Menu, then tap “Edit Profile” and select what detail you want to change.

article.title: Silong Feature isn't working
article.body: Refer to the Basic Troubleshooting Guide and, preferably, perform the steps one at a time.

article.title: Account Deactivation or Deletion
article.body: To deactivate your account temporarily or permanently, simply select "Edit Profile", then select "Account Security" and tap “Deactivate Account” or “Delete Account”. Once deactivated you’ll need admin approval to activate the account again. On the other hand, deleting your account is permanent and can’t be undone.

article.title: No Email Received
article.body: For gmail accounts, check in the spam folder; for outlook, search in the junk folder.

article.title: Timeline don't reflect changes immediately
article.body: Internet connection greatly impacts real-time update of timeline, if problem persists, refer to the Basic Troubleshooting Guide and, preferably, perform the steps one at a time.

article.title: Corrupted Pet Picture Displayed on Email
article.body: If the pet’s picture does not appear, simply report Silong’s message as “not spam”.
